channel.title: Compilier ISSUE!
channel.description:
I run my compilier, and i get an error.
client.java:4: 'class' or 'interface' expected import java.util.GregorianCalender;:: ^
I am using TestScape.
Here is my compilier code. [scar]@echo off title DragonStoneAlpha Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause[/scar]

item.title: Compilier ISSUE!

item.description:
@DragonStoneScapeGM wrote:

im just posting my fixed code so people can look at it and then use it if i have any problems to tell me if they know how to fix it and what exabtly is the problem. But i was thinking about posting it.

Read full topic

item.title: Compilier ISSUE!
item.dc:creator: @DragonStoneScapeGM DragonStoneScapeGM
item.description:
@DragonStoneScapeGM wrote:

i got it, i had to edit the code

[scar]@echo off
COLOR 04
title Yourservername client
“C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_09injavac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:Program FilesJavajre1.5.0_09injava.exe” -cp . server
pause[/scar]

-cp . fixed it.

but i wounder why my client.java isn’t working, i changed it up some, i added some things
[br][size=1]Posted at: October 12, 2006, 09:33:48 PM[/size][hr]Now my server won’t work!!

Read full topic

item.title: Compilier ISSUE!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

here make a new text file and rename it to:

run&compile.bat

then right click it and put this in it:

@echo off COLOR 02 title Yourservername client "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java "C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_07\bin/java.exe" server pause

change the “06” or “07” to different ones until it works. If it still doesnt then go to this address:
http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
Then download:

“JDK 5.0 Update 9”
Then once in the downlaod screen click this link:
“Windows Offline Installation, Multi-language”

Then after the download, go back into editing your run&compile and switch bothe of the 0_'s to 09. This WILL make your run&compile work and work a lot better.

[hidefromsilab]rep++ always helps lolz[/hidefromsilab]

Read full topic
